intro: Erythroxylum panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian erythroxylum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain fine, white, powdery seeds. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
